Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration Officer was functus officio and could refuse to reconsider a withdrawn sponsorship application
Application_Facts: Applicant withdrew sponsorship application due to income eligibility issues and later requested reconsideration
Decision_Outcome: Officer refused reconsideration, citing functus officio
Court_Ruling: Judicial review allowed; case remitted to another immigration officer for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration Officer refused to reconsider the withdrawn application, asserting functus officio
Grounds_for_Claim: Officer incorrectly applied the functus officio doctrine and failed to exercise residual discretion
Legal_Standard: Administrative decision-makers retain discretion to reconsider decisions unless legally barred
Assessment_Factor: Existence of residual discretion in administrative decision-makers
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of an administrative immigration decision
Evidence_Used: Evidence that the officer had discretion to reconsider the application
Application_Basis: Request for reconsideration of a withdrawn sponsorship application
Evidence_Assessed: Evidence showing the officer retained discretion to act
Relief_Sought: Judicial review and remittal for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: Administrative decision-makers have residual discretion to reconsider unless barred by law; functus officio applies only after all steps are completed
Cause_Description: Applicant's withdrawal of sponsorship application and subsequent request for reconsideration
Evidence_Assessment: The court assessed evidence indicating the officer had discretion to reconsider
Decision_Rationale: The officer erred in claiming functus officio as they retained discretion to reconsider the application
Legal_Standard_Applied: Functus officio doctrine and residual discretion in administrative law
